message_1: Consider the vector bundle over the circle $\mathbb{S}^1$ given by the Mobius strip. Let $E$ denote the Mobius strip bundle and $E_x$ be the fiber over a point $x$. If the local trivialization of $E$ is given by $U_1=(-\epsilon,\epsilon)\times \mathbb{S}^1$ and $U_2=(-\epsilon,\epsilon)\times \mathbb{S}^1$ with the transition function $g: U_1\cap U_2\rightarrow GL(1,\mathbb{R})$ given by $g(t,\theta)=-[\begin{matrix} 1 & 0  \\ 0 & -1 \end{matrix}]$ for $t>0$, then what is the first Stiefel-Whitney class of $E$?
message_2:
The first Stiefel-Whitney class, denoted by $w_1(E)$, is an element of the first cohomology group $H^1(\mathbb{S}^1; \mathbb{Z}_2)$. It is defined using the transition functions of the vector bundle.

In this case, the transition function $g(t, \theta)$ is given by the matrix $-[\begin{matrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{matrix}]$. Since the determinant of this matrix is 1, it is an element of $GL(1, \mathbb{R})$. However, the first Stiefel-Whitney class is defined using the mod 2 reduction of the transition functions, so we need to consider the mod 2 reduction of the determinant.

The determinant of the matrix is 1, and its mod 2 reduction is 1. Therefore, the first Stiefel-Whitney class $w_1(E)$ is nontrivial and equal to the generator of $H^1(\mathbb{S}^1; \mathbb{Z}_2) \cong \mathbb{Z}_2$.
